instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00687: What is 820-00687? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.EDP_BKLT_EN: What is EDP_BKLT_EN? This is an enable signal. Anytime you see “_EN”, it means when the voltage is high(3.3 volts), whatever it is going to is being turned on or enabled. Here, “EDP_BKLT” which stands for “embedded displayport backlight” is being enabled. This signal usually goes to an LED driver used for creating a power rail for the LCD screen backlight, to tell it to turn on & create this rail. .
definitions.PP3V3_S0SW_LCD: What is PP3V3_S0SW_LCD? PP3V3_S0SW_LCD is a 3.3v power rail necessary to power the image circuitry on the screen. This is necessary to get a picture on the screen. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00687</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO BACKLIGHT
threads.message:
Hi, this board is not creating the <SIGNAL>EDP_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> signal required to enable the backlight chip <CHIP>U8401</CHIP>, is there a way to make a jumper or something so the backlight work again? I know the signal comes from the CPU is there anything that can be done to fix it?
I´ve already tried the monitor with another logic and everything works fine

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00687</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO BACKLIGHT
threads.message:
Do you get image?
Did you check for external video, or USB activity at least?

Check presence of 3V3/<SIGNAL>5V_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> (LCD connected).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00687</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO BACKLIGHT
threads.message:
I get image when I connect it to a external display... The computer works fine... it´s just the backlight that isn´t working...
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL> = 0 (pulsed to .800)
<SIGNAL>PP5V_SOSW_LCD</SIGNAL> = 0v (pulses to 5v and drops)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00687</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO BACKLIGHT
threads.message:
"and <SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL>"
Any pulse there?

Check if 3V3/<SIGNAL>5V_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL>, stay high few seconds more without LCD connected.
Also check diode mode to ground on both rails, w/ and w/o LCD assembly.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00687</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO BACKLIGHT
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> = 0 (pulses to ,600 drops to ,250 then to 0v)

diode mode LCD connected
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL> = ,406
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL> = ,453

diode mode LCD disconnected
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL> = ,570
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL> = ,668
<SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> = ,781

<SIGNAL>EDP_PANEL_PWR</SIGNAL> = 0 (pulses to 3.3 and drops)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00687</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO BACKLIGHT
threads.message:
In this case, internal image is also missing.

<SIGNAL>EDP_PANEL_PWR</SIGNAL> drops fast too?
Check if stays present few seconds more without LCD.
Did you try another LCD assembly?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00687</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO BACKLIGHT
threads.message: LCD is good, I connected another working logic board to it and it worked fine... <SIGNAL>EDP_PANEL_PWR</SIGNAL> drops at the same time that the lcd voltages

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00687</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO BACKLIGHT
threads.message:
These voltages must be present few seconds at least; even without LCD connected.
Check 3V3/<SIGNAL>5V_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL> behavior on the working board, disconnecting LCD assembly.
Also compare diode mode readings on video lines between the boards.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00687</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO BACKLIGHT
threads.message:
I don´t have the working board anymore so I can´t compare the voltages
Is there a way to make a jumper to the enable of <CHIP>U8401</CHIP> ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00687</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO BACKLIGHT
threads.message:
<CHIP>U8401</CHIP> requires more than enable signal.
There is an I2C communication with T-CON, inside LCD assemnly.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00687</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO BACKLIGHT
threads.message: So for sure that is working, because it worked with the other board... is the <SIGNAL>EDP_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> a signal or an enable voltage?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00687</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO BACKLIGHT
threads.message:
Is a DC signal, which goes high to enable backlight.

However, if <SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> is not high, don't waste time with backlight circuit; image is also missing.
PCH needs this signal to detect internal LCD!!!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00687</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO BACKLIGHT
